Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.leaders.leader_abilities

Interface LeaderAbility

All Superinterfaces:
AcceptsSupplies, HasStatus
All Known Implementing Classes:
Depot, Discount, Market, Producer
public interface LeaderAbility extends AcceptsSupplies, HasStatus
Interface that manages the ability of Leader Cards

  • Method Details

    • getDiscount

      default SupplyContainer getDiscount() throws NoSuchMethodException
      First ability: when the player buys a SupplyCard, he can do it using less resources
      Returns:
      The discount to apply to the SupplyCard
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - If the LeaderCard is not allowed to use that ability

    • transformWhiteMarble

      default WarehouseObjectType transformWhiteMarble() throws NoSuchMethodException
      Third ability: when the player gets white marbles from market, player can choose one of the resources to get
      Returns:
      The resource to get in exchange for white marble
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - If the LeaderCard is not allowed to use that ability

      the color to what the white marble can be transformed

    • getDepotInfo

      default Pair<WarehouseObjectType,​Integer> getDepotInfo() throws NoSuchMethodException
      Method that gives information about the quantity of every resource in that depot
      Returns:
      The pair composed by the resource and its quantity
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - If the LeaderCard is not allowed to use that ability

    • addMarble

      default void addMarble​(MarbleColor color, LeadersSpace ls) throws MarbleException, SupplyException, NoSuchMethodException
      Tries to add a marble to a depot container
      Parameters:
      color - color to add
      ls - used to check if a white ball conversion is possible
      Throws:
      MarbleException - cannot add the specified marble color to the depot, or conversion is not possible
      SupplyException - depot is full
      NoSuchMethodException - If the LeaderCard is not allowed to use that ability

    • getInput

      default SupplyContainer getInput() throws NoSuchMethodException
      Gets the input/mutable input of the production selected
      Returns:
      the SupplyContainer containing the input of the production
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - If the LeaderCard is not allowed to use that ability

    • produce

      default SupplyContainer produce() throws NoSuchMethodException
      This method activates the leader card production
      Returns:
      An extra SupplyContainer that contains the resource
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - If the LeaderCard is not allowed to use that ability

    • checkProduction

      default void checkProduction() throws SupplyException, NoSuchMethodException
      This method checks if the LeaderCard actually can activate the production
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException - If the LeaderCard is not allowed to use that ability
      SupplyException

    • swapProduction

      default void swapProduction​(WarehouseObjectType wot) throws SupplyException, NoSuchMethodException
      Substitutes the current supply present in the specified output slot with the supply given as argument, in the Producer Ability
      Parameters:
      wot - supply to replace
      Throws:
      SupplyException - the container cannot accept the supply
      NoSuchMethodException - If the LeaderCard is not allowed to use that ability

    • changeOutput

      default void changeOutput​(WarehouseObjectType wot) throws SupplyException, NoSuchMethodException
      Method that set the desired resource in addition to the FAITH_MARKER that player will get from the LeaderCard
      Parameters:
      wot - Is one of the five types of resources in the game
      Throws:
      SupplyException - If you want to add more than one resource
      NoSuchMethodException - If the LeaderCard is not allowed to use that ability

    • clearSupplies

      default Pair<SupplyContainer,​SupplyContainer> clearSupplies() throws NoSuchMethodException
      Removes all of the supplies.
      Specified by:
      clearSupplies in interface AcceptsSupplies
      Returns:
      A pair of SupplyContainer containing the removed supplies. The first element contains supplies from the depots, the second one supplies from the strongbox.
      Throws:
      NoSuchMethodException
